channel.title: INfinance
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from INfinance, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Logan Paul’s $5.3 million Pokémon bet raises a bigger question: Do collectibles belong in your portfolio?
item.description: Collectibles may offer eye-catching returns, but not all financial experts are on board.

item.title: ‘Is this really what college bowl games have become?’: Critics say goofy Pop-Tarts and Duke’s Mayo sponsorships are overshadowing the football
item.description: Notre Dame decided to pass up an invitation to play in the Pop-Tarts Bowl, which is set for Saturday

item.title: Too many people forgot their RMDs last year. Don’t make this ‘billion-dollar mistake.’
item.description: You have until Dec. 31 to take your required distribution. Consider this your wake-up call.

item.title: Would you take a $120,000 pay cut to work from home full time?

item.title: Jake Paul-Anthony Joshua fight almost cost DraftKings $100 million. Everyday bettors lost instead.
item.description: Sportsbooks have been having a tough year — but the Paul-Joshua fight was a good night for the house.

item.title: Comex Gold, Silver Settle Lower
item.description: Gold settled 1.4% lower, down two of the past three sessions, and silver fell 2.5%, down three of the past four sessions.

item.title: DeepSeek Won't Sink U.S. AI Titans
item.description: Panic fueling the selloff of Nvidia, Broadcom and other tech giants is overblown.
